Download data and reports

The data used to produce the charts of the main report and the Child Poverty update is available for download below. The files also contain further poverty and child poverty analysis which is not included in the main report.

Poverty and child poverty data

Estimates are averages of three years’ worth of data in order to reduce data volatility and show trends more accurately.

  • All data (xlsx, 330 KB) - all data from the report, combines the spreadsheets below except for the single-year data
  • Headline poverty estimates (xlsx, 32 KB) - data used for poverty and child poverty chapters
  • Poverty characteristics (xlsx, 150 KB) - data used for equality analysis chapter and more
  • Child poverty characteristic (xlsx, 125 KB) - data used for child poverty priority group analysis and more
  • Income analysis (xslx, 44 KB) - data used for income and income inequality chapters
  • Confidence intervals (docx, 26 KB) - measurement uncertainty information for the headline estimates

In addition, estimates based on single years of data are also available. These are used in the infographic Child poverty update alongside the trend data, but otherwise not used in the charts.

  • Poverty estimates single-year (xlsx, 32 KB)
  • Income analysis single-year (xlsx, 42 KB)

Persistent poverty data

Tables of the persistent poverty estimates are included in the Persistent Poverty report.
